alert.note: Alert for Lower Clark Fork Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 05 at 2:14PM MST until January 05 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow followed by light freezing rain is expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 36 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Evaro Hill, Highway 200 Thompson Falls to Plains, Highway 200 Trout Creek to Heron, and I-90 Lookout Pass to Haugan. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 8 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
